intro: Alocasia monticola, commonly known as the mountain alocasia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in length. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with thick, fleshy stems that store water. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically green or yellow in color. Alocasia monticola thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
